unnormalised: Indian Railways Introduces New Rules for Tatkal Booking, Aims for Efficiency
normalised: Indian Railways Introduces New Rules for Tatkal Booking, Aims for Efficiency

unnormalised: New Delhi: Indian Railways has announced revised guidelines for Tatkal ticket booking, effective 01/07/2024. These changes aim to streamline the process and reduce the load on the IRCTC website during peak hours. The Tatkal scheme allows passengers to book tickets at short notice, typically 1 day before the journey.
normalised: New Delhi: Indian Railways has announced revised guidelines for Tatkal ticket booking, effective first july two thousand and twenty four. These changes aim to streamline the process and reduce the load on the I-R-C-T-C website during peak hours. The Tatkal scheme allows passengers to book tickets at short notice, typically one day before the journey.

unnormalised: Under the new rules, booking timings for AC classes (2A, 3A, CC, etc.) will begin at 10:00 AM, while non-AC classes (SL, 2S) will commence at 11:00 AM. This staggered approach is intended to distribute the demand and prevent website crashes.
normalised: Under the new rules, booking timings for A-C classes (two A, three A, C-C, et cetera) will begin at ten A-M, while non-A-C classes (S-L, two S) will commence at eleven A-M. This staggered approach is intended to distribute the demand and prevent website crashes.

unnormalised: Further, the railways have increased the per-user booking limit to 6 tickets, but only 2 Tatkal tickets can be booked per IP address during the first 30 mins. This measure intends to curb bulk bookings by agents. Passengers are advised to ensure all details are accurate before payment, as cancellation charges apply as per existing rules.
normalised: Further, the railways have increased the per-user booking limit to six tickets, but only two Tatkal tickets can be booked per I-P address during the first thirty minutes. This measure intends to curb bulk bookings by agents. Passengers are advised to ensure all details are accurate before payment, as cancellation charges apply as per existing rules.

unnormalised: IRCTC's mobile app and website will display real-time availability of seats, updated every 5 minutes. "Our goal is to provide a seamless and transparent booking experience for all passengers," stated a railway official. The new system aims to curtail fraudulent practices and prioritize genuine travelers.

"Our goal is to provide a seamless and transparent booking experience for all passengers," stated a railway official. unnormalised: Passengers are encouraged to utilize the "Ask Disha" chatbot on the IRCTC website for any queries. It is expected that these updates will result in smoother operations, reduced wait times, and greater convenience for train travelers across India. For detailed information and rules, visit www.irctc.co.in.
